text: Pericallis echinata is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Tenerife in the Canary Islands. ==Description== Pericallis echinata is an upright herbaceous perennial plant, growing to . The leaves are rounded in shape, with toothed margins. The inflorescence is composed of 5–15 heads of flowers, each about across, with 11–14 pink ray florets. Pericallis echinata kz2.jpg|Flowers ==Distribution and habitat== Pericallis echinata is endemic to the Canary Islands. It is found in the north-west of Tenerife. On the north coast, large numbers of plants may be found locally in Cistus scrub and on rocky slopes. It is found much less often in the south of the island. ==References== echinata Category:Endemic flora of the Canary Islands
title: Pericallis echinata
